title: Use OData for SAM reports
content:
You can use data visualization software (such as Power BI) to create SAM reports by using the Service Management OData service. The Service Management OData data model includes SAM record types. See SAM data model for details of the SAM-related record types.

This page describes the prerequisites for using OData for SAM-related reports. In addition, it describes how to import some OData-based sample SAM reports to Power BI. You can import the sample reports and review the report details in Power BI.

Prerequisites

To use OData for SAM reports, you must meet the following prerequisites:

  • You have read the Service Management OData service documentation and understood how it works and how to use it.

    When you enter authentication details for connecting to the OData service, you must use the credentials of a user with the Access OData API permission and the View permission for these record types: License, License metric, Product, Product compliance, Product version, Product version compliance, Software publisher.

  • The data for certain record types in the SAM data model are federated via the UCMDB Gateway. You need to establish connection with the UCMDB Gateway so that you can access such data via OData. To do this, configure SAM-related parameters in UD/UCMDB. See the following topics depending on the UD/UCMDB you installed:

    • Containerized UD/UCMDB: Configure these SAM-related parameters in the my-values.yaml file: cmsgateway.deployment.sam.host, cmsgateway.deployment.sam.port, cmsgateway.deployment.sam.context. See Service Management integration parameters.
    • Classic UD/UCMDB: Configure the parameters in the [SAM] section of the config.properties file. See Install UCMDB Gateway on Windows or Install UCMDB Gateway on Linux.

  • If you enable SAM in a tenant that already has the OData service enabled, you need to do the following to load the SAM metadata to the Service Management OData service.

    Send a GET request to the following endpoint (with the credential of a tenant admin):

    https://<FQDN>:<port>/rest/<tenant ID>/datahub-api/admin/invalidate-cache

Import sample report to Power BI

Import the sample SAM report file, which you can download from the ITOM Marketplace, by using Power BI Desktop. You can then examine the sample report to learn how to create your own SAM reports using OData.

  1. Double-click the downloaded sample report (.PBIT file). This automatically launches Power BI Desktop and loads the template.

  2. Power BI Desktop will display the OData feed form. Click Cancel to close the form. You need to update the OData feed provided in the sample report and enter credentials in the next few steps in order to display the report.

  3. Power BI Desktop will display some warning messages in the "Refresh" popup window. Close the popup window.

  4. From the Home tab, Select Transform data > Data source settings. This opens the Data source settings form.

  5. Click Change Source.

  6. Update the URL on the OData feed form.

  7. Click Edit Permissions.

  8. Click Edit under Credentials, and then update the credentials on the Basic tab of the form that opens.

  9. Click Refresh now in the message pane at the top of the report pane. Power BI Desktop will load the data by using the latest configuration and then display the report.
